main event: A bright orange object about the size of the 2nd star in the Big Dipper was observed traveling in a straight line downward for about 200 yards before suddenly disappearing in Bay City, Michigan on March 4, 1968.
interesting points: The object did not make any noise and had a definite orange color.
The object traveled in a straight line downward for about 200 yards before suddenly disappearing.
The sighting lasted for about 60 seconds.
The object was observed at an angle of about 25 degrees west of the horizon, near the lower end of the Big Dipper constellation.
The sighting occurred around 6:50 PM local time.
sighted object: bright orange object about the size of the 2nd star in the Big Dipper
